article_title: L. Gordon Crovitz: John Oliver Makes People Dumb
article_text:
Does the Internet make people stupid? This column has been on the optimistic side: Surely humans can still find a way to focus on and understand complex topics. But that faith is being sorely tested by the abysmal Washington debate over "net neutrality."

Monday is the deadline for public comments on proposed Internet regulations to the Federal Communications Commission. More than one million comments have been posted, mostly sent by "clicktivists" and drafted by special-interest groups in Washington. As...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, L. Gordon Crovitz writes that treating the Internet like a utility won't promote competition, no matter what 'clicktivists' say.
twitter.title: John Oliver Makes People Dumb

og.title: John Oliver Makes People Dumb

article_metadata.author: L. Gordon Crovitz

article_summary:
More than one million comments have been posted, mostly sent by "clicktivists" and drafted by special-interest groups in Washington.
This column has been on the optimistic side: Surely humans can still find a way to focus on and understand complex topics.
Monday is the deadline for public comments on proposed Internet regulations to the Federal Communications Commission.
But that faith is being sorely tested by the abysmal Washington debate over "net neutrality."
Does the Internet make people stupid?
